net.majorkernelpanic.streaming.video

Class VideoStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.majorkernelpanic.streaming.MediaStream
      • net.majorkernelpanic.streaming.video.VideoStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stream
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    H263Stream, H264Stream

    public abstract class VideoStream
extends MediaStream
    Don't use this class directly.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VideoStream

        public VideoStream()
        Don't use this class directly. Uses CAMERA_FACING_BACK by default.

      • VideoStream

        public VideoStream(int camera)
        Don't use this class directly
        Parameters:
        camera - Can be either CameraInfo.CAMERA_FACING_BACK or CameraInfo.CAMERA_FACING_FRONT

    • Method Detail

      • setCamera

        public void setCamera(int camera)
        Sets the camera that will be used to capture video. You can call this method at any time and changes will take effect next time you start the stream.
        Parameters:
        camera - Can be either CameraInfo.CAMERA_FACING_BACK or CameraInfo.CAMERA_FACING_FRONT

      • switchCamera

        public void switchCamera()
                  throws java.lang.RuntimeException,
                         java.io.IOException
        Switch between the front facing and the back facing camera of the phone. If startPreview() has been called, the preview will be briefly interrupted. If start() has been called, the stream will be briefly interrupted. You should not call this method from the main thread if you are already streaming.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.RuntimeException

      • getCamera

        public int getCamera()
        Returns the id of the camera currently selected. Can be either Camera.CameraInfo.CAMERA_FACING_BACK or Camera.CameraInfo.CAMERA_FACING_FRONT.

      • setSurfaceView

        public void setSurfaceView(SurfaceView view)
        Sets a Surface to show a preview of recorded media (video). You can call this method at any time and changes will take effect next time you call start().

      • setFlashState

        public void setFlashState(boolean state)
        Turns the LED on or off if phone has one.

      • toggleFlash

        public void toggleFlash()
        Toggles the LED of the phone if it has one. You can get the current state of the flash with getFlashState().

      • getFlashState

        public boolean getFlashState()
        Indicates whether or not the flash of the phone is on.

      • setPreviewOrientation

        public void setPreviewOrientation(int orientation)
        Sets the orientation of the preview.
        Parameters:
        orientation - The orientation of the preview

      • setVideoQuality

        public void setVideoQuality(VideoQuality videoQuality)
        Sets the configuration of the stream. You can call this method at any time and changes will take effect next time you call configure() .
        Parameters:
        videoQuality - Quality of the stream

      • getVideoQuality

        public VideoQuality getVideoQuality()
        Returns the quality of the stream.

      • setPreferences

        public void setPreferences(android.content.SharedPreferences prefs)
        Some data (SPS and PPS params) needs to be stored when getSessionDescription() is called
        Parameters:
        prefs - The SharedPreferences that will be used to save SPS and PPS parameters

      • configure

        public void configure()
               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                      java.io.IOException
        Configures the stream. You need to call this before calling getSessionDescription() to apply your configuration of the stream.
        Specified by:
        configure in interface Stream
        Overrides:
        configure in class MediaStream
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        java.io.IOException

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                  java.io.IOException
        Starts the stream. This will also open the camera and dispay the preview if startPreview() has not aready been called.
        Specified by:
        start in interface Stream
        Overrides:
        start in class MediaStream
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        java.io.IOException

      • stop

        Stops the stream.
        Specified by:

        Overrides:

                  throws CameraInUseException,

        public void stopPreview()
        Stops the preview.

      • encodeWithMediaCodecMethod2

        protected void encodeWithMediaCodecMethod2()
                                    throws java.lang.RuntimeException,
                                           java.io.IOException
        Video encoding is done by a MediaCodec. But here we will use the buffer-to-surface methode
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException
        java.io.IOException

      • getSessionDescription

        public abstract java.lang.String getSessionDescription()
                                                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns a description of the stream using SDP. This method can only be called after Stream.configure().
        Specified by:
        getSessionDescription in interface Stream
        Specified by:
        getSessionDescription in class MediaStream
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown when Stream.configure() wa not called.

      • openCamera

        private void openCamera()
                 throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Opens the camera in a new Looper thread so that the preview callback is not called from the main thread If an exception is thrown in this Looper thread, we bring it back into the main thread.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Might happen if another app is already using the camera.

      • createCamera

        protected void createCamera()
                     throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException

      • destroyCamera

        protected void destroyCamera()

      • updateCamera

        protected void updateCamera()
                     throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException

      • lockCamera

        protected void lockCamera()

      • unlockCamera

        protected void unlockCamera()

      • measureFramerate

        private void measureFramerate()
        Computes the average frame rate at which the preview callback is called. We will then use this average framerate with the MediaCodec. Blocks the thread in which this function is called.
